org.patneu.simpleflash

Class CameraOnNotification

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.patneu.simpleflash.CameraOnNotification

  • public class CameraOnNotification
extends java.lang.Object
    A helper class used to provide instances of the standard Notification that this application sends to the user.

    It also provides some static values related to the behavior of this Notification.
    Since:
    Version 1.0
    Author:

      • NOTIFICATION_RESUME

        public static final int NOTIFICATION_RESUME
        A value indicating to resume its sending Activity when a CameraOnNotification is clicked and/or cancelled.

        Primarily used as the 'click' or 'cancel' parameter of the getInstance(android.content.Context, android.content.Intent, int, int) method.
        Since:
        Version 1.0
        See Also:
        NOTIFICATION_FINISH, NOTIFICATION_NOTHING, Constant Field Values

      • NOTIFICATION_FINISH

        public static final int NOTIFICATION_FINISH
        A value indicating to finish its sending Activity when a CameraOnNotification is clicked and/or cancelled.

        Primarily used as the 'click' or 'cancel' parameter of the getInstance(android.content.Context, android.content.Intent, int, int) method.
        Since:
        Version 1.0
        See Also:
        NOTIFICATION_RESUME, NOTIFICATION_NOTHING, Constant Field Values

      • NOTIFICATION_NOTHING

        public static final int NOTIFICATION_NOTHING
        A value indicating to do nothing when a CameraOnNotification is clicked or cancelled.

        Primarily used as the 'click' or 'cancel' parameter of the getInstance(android.content.Context, android.content.Intent, int, int) method.
        Since:
        Version 1.0
        See Also:
        NOTIFICATION_RESUME, NOTIFICATION_FINISH, Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static android.app.Notification getInstance(android.content.Context context,
                                   android.content.Intent intent,
                                   int click,
                                   int cancel)
        Returns an instance of this application's standard Notification, referred to as the 'CameraOnNotification'.

        This method gets a Notification to tell the user that the camera's flashlight is still turned on, since unintentionally leaving it on may damage the user's device.

        Note: Although this method is named 'getInstance', it doesn't actually use any constructor of this class (which wouldn't have sense anyway, since the class doesn't extend the Notification class. Instead, it internally builds a new Notification using the NotificationCompat.Builder class.
        Parameters:
        context - the Context of the Activity that wants to send this Notification
        intent - should be the Intent that originally started the sending Activity, as provided by Activity.getIntent()
        click - defines what to do if the user clicks this Notification, should be one of the static 'NOTIFICATION_XXX' values
        cancel - defines what to do if the user cancels this Notification, should be one of the static 'NOTIFICATION_XXX' values
        Returns:
        an instance of this application's standard Notification with the specified behavior
        Since:
        Version 1.0
